snippet: Voters in three counties approved a property tax that is expected to raise $23 million a year for the Detroit Institute of Arts, which receives no financial support from either the city or the state.
abstract: Voters in three Michigan counties agree to institute a property tax increase earmarked specifically for the Detroit Institute of Arts, saving it from devastating budget cuts.
lead_paragraph: Voters in three counties approved a property tax that is expected to raise $23 million a year for the Detroit Institute of Arts, which receives no financial support from either the city or the state.

headline.seo: Detroit Institute of Arts County Millage Tax Approved
headline.main: Suburban Taxpayers Vote to Support Detroit Museum
headline.print_headline: Suburban Taxpayers Vote to Support Detroit Museum
